thread.title: High school football: Riordan rides its high-powered offense to a 66-45 win over Serra
thread.title_full: High school football: Riordan rides its high-powered offense to a 66-45 win over Serra

author:
Glenn Reeves

greeves@bayareanewsgroup.com
title: High school football: Riordan rides its high-powered offense to a 66-45 win over Serra
text:
High school football: Riordan rides its high-powered offense to a 66-45 win over Serra By Glenn Reeves Posted: 10/10/2015 08:04:43 PM PDT Updated: 10/10/2015 08:04:44 PM PDT SAN FRANCISCO -- The West Catholic Athletic League, that league known for coaching, game planning, depth and, most of all, great defense, is getting turned on its ear by the Archbishop Riordan football team. 
The Crusaders, a 1-9 last-place outfit a year ago, improved to 5-0 with a thrill-a-minute 66-45 win Saturday over Serra at City College of San Francisco. 
Riordan has scored 226 points through five games this season after scoring 145 over a full 10-game schedule a year ago. 
"We changed the offense this off-season to help get the ball in space,'' first-year Riordan coach Kevin Fordon said. "And our line is playing light's out. The big uglies, they're amazing.'' 
Quarterback Jacky Luevasa had a career game, completing 15 of 20 passes for 313 yards and five touchdowns. Super-quick running back Raymone Sanders carried 13 times for 187 yards and three touchdowns. Speedy wide receiver Aidan Verba-Hamilton scored four touchdowns.. The Crusaders had 576 yards of total offense and even ran a flea-flicker twice -- getting a touchdown on each occasion, 
Nine touchdowns were scored in the first quarter, five by Riordan, four by Serra. The Crusaders led 32-29 at the end of the quarter and 46-35 at halftime. 
Serra (2-3, 0-2) landed the first punch, taking the opening possession and going 79 yards in five plays for a touchdown. Quarterback Sitaleki Nunn dropped back to pass, was under pressure and took off running, not stopping until he was in the end zone after a 45-yard TD run. A shovel pass to Brandon Monroe made it 8-0 Serra. Advertisement 
And the battle was on. 
Riordan came right back with Sanders scoring the first of his touchdowns on a 5-yard run. 
On three successive plays, Nunn hit Kelepi Lataimua for a 31-yard touchdown, Luavasa threw a 64-yard touchdown pass to Verba-Hamilton and Monroe scored on an 89-yard kickoff return. 
Serra led 29-18 after a 40-yard TD run by Lataimua with 58 seconds left in the quarter. But, somehow, Riordan scored two touchdowns to take the lead before the quarter ended -- Jamarian Caston on a 74-yard kickoff return and then on the last play of the quarter it was Luavasa to Verba-Hamilton on a 42-yard touichdown pass on a flea flicker. 
"That was fun,'' Luevasa said. 
Riordan added two more touchdowns in the five minutes of the second quarter to extend its lead to 46-29 after a 3-yard fumble return by Rocco Russell. That was one of five fumbles lost by Serra. 
"We need to go back and clean those up,'' Serra offensive coordinator Steven Lo said. Nunn carried 16 times for 128 yards and Lataimua 18 times for 126 yards for Serra, which had 480 yards of total offense. Monroe caught nine passes for 164 yards. 
"It's a wacky league this year,'' Serra coach Patrick Walsh said. "We did a lot of good things today, the effort was there. Unfortunately I didn't have the team in the frame of mind to execute. That's my fault.'' Riordan 66, Serra 45 
Serra 29 6 7 3 -- 45 
Riordan 32 14 13 7 -- 66 
S -- Nunn 45 run (Monroe pass from Nunn) 
R -- Sanders 5 run (pass failed) 
S -- Lataimua 31 pass from Nunn (Slone kick) 
R -- Verba-Hamilton 64 pass from Luevasa (kick failed) 
S -- Monroe 89 kickoff return (Slone kick) 
R -- Verba-Hamilton 11 pass from Luevasa (pass failed) 
S -- Lataimua 40 run (Slone kick) 
R -- Caston 74 kickoff return (run failed) 
R -- Verba-Hamilton 42 pass from Luavasa (Sanders run) 
R -- McAfee 57 pass from Luevasa (Greene run) 
R -- Russell 3 fumble return (run failed) 
S -- Monroe 13 pass from Nunn (pass failed) 
R -- Sanders 73 run (run failed) 
R -- Verba-Hamilton 76 pass from Luevasa (Ennis kick) 
S -- Monroe 17 pass from Damelio (Slone kick) 
S -- Slone 31 FG 
R -- Sanders 27 run (Ennis kick) 
Records: Serra 2-3, 0-2; Riordan 5-0, 2-0.
